comments.body: Same question here- so this change keeps the module from bombing, but are we actually doing the correct thing? We're not in the managed disk case, so why do we have an OS disk without a vhd?

@nitzmahone this is actually pretty difficult to reproduce. it happens with VMs not created by Ansible. In this particular case VM was somehow created in Azure Portal, and existing os disk was somehow attached.... so it's something really rare, but happens. there may be more such issues unfortunately. I keep wondering how we should support existining resources in Ansible....
agree with matt. the change itself looks good, but it doesn't resolve the issue #39958 because it doesn't resolve the key not exists, but change it to none error.

@yungezz How to deal [#39958](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/39958) and [#41003](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/41003)? It seem fixed by this PR? Could we can close these two issue and create new PR to fix the key not exists issue ? Thanks!

comments.body: elif? or vm_dict['properties'].get('diagnosticsProfile')

I cannot guarantee that Azure will always return a diagnosticsProfile.  In fact, I don't think it does when the feature has never been configured.  So the first "if" statement is correct.

I cannot guarantee that Azure will always return a bootDiagnostics inside the diagnosticsProfile, therefore the second "if" is also correct.  elif would cause it to do the wrong thing
why 'd'?
it follows other options, which are "started", "stopped".... etc....
